title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 1-2.7 - Foreign corporation - maintaining an office
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 1-2.7 - Foreign corporation - maintaining an office

State Regulations

Tax Law, section 209(1)
A foreign corporation that maintains an office in New

York State is engaged in an activity that makes it subject to tax. An office is
any area, enclosure or facility that is used in the regular course of the
corporate business. A salesperson's home, a hotel room, or a trailer used on a
construction job site may constitute an office. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
1-2.7

Adopted

New

York State Register December 27, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 52, eff. 12/27/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
